body_html:
Interestingly, it looks like the aten code for PReLU backward is generated differently on python 2 vs python3.

Python2:
if (grad_weight_) grad_weight_->maybeScalar(self_->isScalar());

Python3:
if (grad_input_) grad_input_->maybeScalar(self_->isScalar());
It seems like it would be reasonable to add a test that the aten code is the same across python versions.
body:
Interestingly, it looks like the aten code for PReLU backward is generated differently on python 2 vs python3.

Python2:
`
if (grad_weight_) grad_weight_->maybeScalar(self_->isScalar());
`

Python3:
`
if (grad_input_) grad_input_->maybeScalar(self_->isScalar());
`
It seems like it would be reasonable to add a test that the aten code is the same across python versions.
